results.title: The trials of life: a natural history of behaviour. - Part 1.
results.creator_credit: Peter Jones, ABC-TV (Australia), BBC and Turner Broadcasting System
results.brief_description: Six half-hour episodes of David Attenborough’s series on animal behaviour, examining why creatures behave as they do and showing that their lives are a series of problems to be faced and overcome. The episodes are - 1. Arriving (on reproduction and birth) 2. Growing up (on parental protection) 3. Finding food (the interdependence of plants and animals) 4. Hunting & escaping (Attack and defence behaviour) 5. Living together (Companion species) 6. Home making (Burrows, nests etc. for safety).

results.title: La Bamba (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Luis Valdez, Taylor Hackford, Columbia and New Visions Pictures
results.brief_description: Musical biography of Ritchie Valens, a poor Mexican-American who became a rock’n’roll sensation at age 17 in the 1950’s. Lou Diamond Phillips portrays Valens whose musical career ended when he was killed in the plane crash that also claimed the life of Buddy Holly. The music of Valens is performed by Los Lobos on the soundtrack.

results.title: Atlantic City USA
results.creator_credit: Louis Malle, Denis Heroux, Cine-Neighbour and Selta Films
results.brief_description: The legalisation of gambling in Atlantic City brings about big changes in the life of an aging, smalltime numbers runner, especially when he meets up with a beautiful younger woman who entangles him with the Mob. Starring Burt Lancaster and Susan Sarandon.

results.title: Ghostbusters (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd and Harold Ramis star as the freelance crusaders who team up as the Ghostbusters Squad. Armed with ectoplasmic swats and patented booby traps, they walk a fine line between scientific genius and lunacy in their quest to rid the city of slimy, haunting monsters on the rampage in New York.

results.title: The New Adventures of Pippi Longstocking (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ken Annakin, Gary Mehlman, Walter Moshay and Columbia
results.brief_description: Based on the classic book by Astrid Lindgren, Pippi Longstocking bursts on to the screen in this action film. Pippi is a pig-tailed, freckle-faced ball of fun and energy. Mischievous, lovable and always in trouble, Pippi is a young orphan who refuses to let anything stand in her way. Full of colourful characters, fun and laughs “The new adventures of Pippi Longstocking” is a delightful adventure movie for the young and the young at heart.

results.title: Job search: the pre-interview
results.brief_description: Through the eyes of three school leavers, we see how jobs are researched using available community resources to obtain work information. Use of the CES, municipal libraries, newspapers and parental advice is covered. The program also covers the correct preparation of job applications.

results.title: La Stupenda: a portrait of Dame Joan Sutherland
results.creator_credit: Derek Bailey, Brian Adams and Landseer Film and Television Productions
results.brief_description: A celebration of the life and career of Australia’s most famous opera star, Dame Joan Sutherland, culminating in her farewell performances in Sydney and London in 1990. Sutherland’s career spanned more than forty years. “La Stupenda” provides an overview of the highlights of her career.

results.title: Gentlemen Prefer Blondes
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Sol Siegel and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Two showgirls go to Paris in search of rich husbands in this musical comedy which is memorable for the score and songs such as “Diamonds are a girl’s best friend”. Starring Marilyn Monroe, Jane Russell and Charles Coburn. Based on the novel by Anita Loos.

constellations_primary.name: Diamonds are still a girl's best friend
constellations_primary.description: This constellation explores the continuing cultural impact of Marylin Monroe’s iconic performance of 'Diamonds are a Girl’s Best Friend' in Gentlemen prefer Blondes (1953).

results.title: The Philadelphia story
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Joseph L Mankiewicz and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A wealthy society girl, who is about to marry for the second time, finds she still loves her first husband. Cukor’s direction is so discreet you can hardly sense it. Starring Katharine Hepburn, Cary Grant and James Stewart. Based on a play by Philip Barry.
